hours_text:
### **Hours:**

The museum is open Wednesday-Sunday from 10AM-5PM. The museum will be closed Easter Sunday, Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Year’s Day.

### **Tickets:**

Tickets are available at the admission desk inside the museum or online [here](http://68810.blackbaudhosting.com/68810/tickets?tab=3&txobjid=48bc06ec-ce64-4aa0-aa58-a8fb869f75c8).  
Children (6 and younger) – Free  
Youth (7 to 17) – $10  
Students – $10  
Veterans/Educators/Seniors (65 and older) – $12  
Adults (18 to 64) – $15

### **Special Discount Days:**

Senior Days – Every first Wednesday of the month will feature half price tickets for all senior citizens, age 65 and older.  
Student Days – Every first Thursday of the month will feature half price tickets for students.  
Family Sundays – Free admission to all children under 12 years old when accompanied by a paying adult. Adult admission is $15.

### **Address:**

602 E 2nd St  
Bethlehem, PA 18015

### **Parking:**

NMIH is located at 602 East Second Street in Bethlehem, PA. Limited free parking is available in the SteelStacks Ruins East and West lots on Second Street between Founder’s Way and Polk Street. Paid parking via the Bethlehem Parking Authority is also available in the adjacent NCC Fowler Center Lot at 511 East Third Street or the Polk Street Garage at the corner of Polk and Second Streets. For more information, visit the Bethlehem Parking Authority [website](https://www.bethpark.org/parking/decks-lots/).

accessibility_text:
We strive to make your visit as comfortable and as inviting as possible. If there are any special needs that you may require during your visit that are not covered on this page, please feel free to reach out to us by emailing [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) or calling 610.694.6644.

**Parking  
**The museum has four handicap parking spaces in the parking lot of the Northampton County Community College Fowler Center located at 511 E 3rd St along the museum’s plaza.

**Wheelchairs  
**The entire museum is wheelchair accessible. Please contact us at 610.694.6644 or [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) if you would like to reserve the Museum’s house wheelchair for use.

**Sign Language/Interpreter Support  
**If you require an interpreter (American Sign Language, language other than English, etc) please contact the museum and allow 30 days for us to obtain an interpreter in order to give you the best experience possible.

collections_text:
* History in the   
Making

explore America's industrial past with the   
National Museum of Industrial History and   
take in over 200 artifacts that tell the stories   
of the 1876 Centennial Exposition, iron,  
steel, textiles, propane, and more 

[Explore](https://nmih.org/exhibits/permanent-exhibits/)

  * #### About the Museum

* * *

  * Housed in the former Electric Repair Shop of the Bethlehem Steel plant site on the vibrant SteelStacks arts & culture campus, the National Museum of Industrial History interprets industry past, present and future through dynamic exhibits, hands-on interactives and engaging programs. Visitors of all ages can enjoy the stories of the people, machines and ideas that transformed our nation through a rich collection of rare artifacts including the esteemed 1876 Smithsonian Industrial collection.

Bring your family to the Smithsonian Affiliate in your neighborhood and explore lively South Bethlehem including the iconic Bethlehem Steel Blast Furnaces, Hoover Mason Trestle, unique retail shops, restaurants and more.  

#### Subscribe to our Mailing List

## Make Your Trip Memorable

* * *

Customize your trip to the National Museum of Industrial History by touring the museum with one of our expert guides, planning a group outing for your club or organization, or hosting an event in one of the most unique spaces in the Lehigh Valley.
